content: The Branch of Righteousness
“Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of My pasture!” says the .

Therefore thus says the  God of Israel against the shepherds who feed My people: “You have scattered My flock, driven them away, and not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for the evil of your doings,” says the .
“But I will gather the remnant of My flock out of all countries where I have driven them, and bring them back to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
I will set up shepherds over them who will feed them; and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, nor shall they be lacking,” says the .THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
“Therefore, behold,  days are coming,” says the , “that they shall no longer say, ‘As the  lives who brought up the children of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
but, ‘As the  lives who brought up and led the descendants of the house of Israel from the north country and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ And they shall dwell in their own land.”
False Prophets and Empty Oracles
My heart within me is broken
Because of the prophets;
All my bones shake.
I am like a drunken man,
And like a man whom wine has overcome,
Because of the ,
And because of His holy words.
For the land is full of adulterers;
For because of a curse the land mourns.
The pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up.
Their course of life is evil,
And their might  not right.
“Therefore thus says the  of hosts concerning the prophets:
Thus says the  of hosts:
“I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in My name, saying, ‘I have dreamed, I have dreamed!’
How long will  be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies? Indeed  prophets of the deceit of their own heart,
who try to make My people forget My name by their dreams which everyone tells his neighbor, as their fathers forgot My name for Baal.
“Therefore behold, I  against the prophets,” says the , “who steal My words every one from his neighbor.
Behold, I  against the prophets,” says the , “who use their tongues and say, ‘He says.’

Behold, I  against those who prophesy false dreams,” says the , “and tell them, and cause My people to err by their lies and by their recklessness. Yet I did not send them or command them; therefore they shall not profit this people at all,” says the .
“So when these people or the prophet or the priest ask you, saying, ‘What is the oracle of the ?’ you shall then say to them, ‘What oracle?’ I will even forsake you,” says the .
“And  the prophet and the priest and the people who say, ‘The oracle of the !’ I will even punish that man and his house.
Thus every one of you shall say to his neighbor, and every one to his brother, ‘What has the  answered?’ and, ‘What has the  spoken?’
And the oracle of the  you shall mention no more. For every man’s word will be his oracle, for you have perverted the words of the living God, the  of hosts, our God.
Thus you shall say to the prophet, ‘What has the  answered you?’ and, ‘What has the  spoken?’
But since you say, ‘The oracle of the !’ therefore thus says the : ‘Because you say this word, “The oracle of the !” and I have sent to you, saying, “Do not say, ‘The oracle of the !’ ”
therefore behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you and forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and  out of My presence.
And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.’ ”
